intro: Lloydia graeca, commonly known as the Greek lloydia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Lloydia graeca is adapted to rocky and dry environments, making it a resilient species in arid conditions. It is often cultivated in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
